refnamediv.refpurpose: set the "user" environment variables from the current UID and GID

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: userenv is a chain-loading utility that sets environment variables and then chain loads to next-prog with the execvp3 function.
next-prog may contain its own command line options, which userenv will ignore.

The following environment variables are set:
UID
Set to the (decimal) numeric value of the process's effective user ID.
GID
Set to the (decimal) numeric value of the process's effective group ID.
HOME
Set to the pathname of the user's home directory, as given in the system account database.
SHELL
Set to the pathname of the user's shell program, as given in the system account database.
USER and LOGNAME
Set to the user's name, as given in the system account database.

refsection.title: BUGS
refsection.para: Although not strictly a bug in this program, it is worth noting that the GNU C library and the BSD C library both have memory leaks in theur setenv3 and unsetenv3 functions, used by this program. You can work around these bugs by ensuring that next-prog is not a built-in command (see exec1).
